Column Comment.0: OBLIGATION ID: Unique identifier for each obligation
Column Comment.1: OBLIGATION SEQ NO: Unique identifier for each part or occurrence of an obligation
Column Comment.2: COMPONENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the component associated with theobligation. Each new FK should be added as a new row of data.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: ACTIVITY OBSERVATION NUMBER: Number uniquely identifying each observationof an activity.
Column Comment.5: ANALYSIS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample analysis. Various types ofanalysis may be conducted on a sample. Samples may be derived from lithologiccuttings, fluid collection etc.
Column Comment.6: APPLICATION ID: Unique identifier for applications you make for continuations,licenses etc. to the government.
Column Comment.7: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.8: AREA TYPE ID: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.9: BA AUTHORITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the row that describes theauthority that a business associaate has over business objects.
Column Comment.10: LICENSEE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the businessassociate to whom this license has been granted.
Column Comment.11: LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the approval granted to conduct activitiesor operations.
Column Comment.12: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ORGANIZATION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for anorganization of a company or organization.
Column Comment.13: ORGANIZATION SEQUENCE NUMBER: a unique number added to alloworganizations to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.14: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE SERVICE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: theunique identifier for the business associate to whom services were provided. Couldbe a company, consortium etc.
Column Comment.15: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE SERVICE PROVIDER: Unique identifier for the businessassociate who provided the services to another business associate.
Column Comment.16: BA SERVICE SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number added to allow a businessassociate to provide multiple services for another business associate.
Column Comment.17: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for the business associate.
Column Comment.18: OBLIGATION CALCULATION METHOD: the method used to calculate theobligation.
Column Comment.19: CATALOGUE ADDITIVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofadditives. Think of this table as a catalogue of all the kinds of additives that can bepurchased or created.
Column Comment.20: EQUIPMENT CATALOGUE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofequipment. Think of this as a catalogue or brochure that shows all the kinds ofequipment that you may use, but may or may not actually have. Actual peices ofequipment that exist are defined in the table EQUIPMENT.
Column Comment.21: CLASSIFICATION: SYSTEM: Identifies and describes the classification system thatis used. The UNSPSC code set is a useful and practical source of classificationinformation.
Column Comment.22: CLASSIFICATION LEVEL IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier used to capture theclassification systems, such as those that describe types of equipment. A number ofclassification schemes are availabe, including the UNSPSC code set. Typically, theseclassification systems are hierarchical. Objects may be classified at any level of theclassification system, and through more than one classification system.
Column Comment.23: OBLIGATION COMPONENT REASON: the reason why the component is associatedwith the obligation. For example, seismic data may be acquired to satisfy the terms ofan obligation, a contract may govern the management of an obligation or a documentmay provide a record of the obligation.
Column Comment.24: CONSENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the consent. Consents grantpermission to conduct operations based on approval of what is done or proposed byanother. Conditions, including actions to be taken or fees to be paid, may or may notbe applied against the consent.
Column Comment.25: CONSULTATION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this consultation as it pertains toan activity or request for an activity. Consultation discussions may occur at any pointin the life cycle of a business object.
Column Comment.26: CONTEST ID: Unique identifier to track a contestment between companies,countries, states and other jurisdictional bodies.
Column Comment.27: CONTRACT EXTENSION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the contract extension.
Column Comment.28: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.29: PROVISION IDENTIFIER: Unique code identifying the provision in the contract.(could be same as clause number e.g. 16 or entered as 16 even though clause isactually numbered XVI - facilitates easier query)
Column Comment.30: CONTRACT SERVICE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: unique number addedto allow a business associate to provide more than one service to a contract.
Column Comment.31: CONTRACT SERVICE SEQUENCE NUMBER: a unique number added to allow abusiness associate to provide more than one service for a contract.
Column Comment.32: CRITICAL DATE: Date which an obligation must be fulfilled
Column Comment.33: DESCRIPTION: Description of the obligation or commitment
Column Comment.34: ECOZONE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sedimentary rock unit or environmentin which fossil deposition occurs. Often, these ecozones are marine or fresh water.Marine ecozones include the category of marine benthic zones, namely shelf, slope,and abyssal zones. The ecozone is defined by the organisms that are found in it.
Column Comment.35: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.36: EMPLOYEE BA: The unique identifier assigned to an employee (or consultant orcontractor) in an organization.
Column Comment.37: EMPLOYEE OBS NO: A sequential counter that tracks an employees moves withinan organization.
Column Comment.38: EMPLOYER_BA: The unique identifier of the organization that has employeesworking for it.
Column Comment.39: ENTITLEMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the row in the entitlement table.
Column Comment.40: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific peice of equipment.
Column Comment.41: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.42: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.43: FACILITY LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the facility license.
Column Comment.44: FACILITY SERVICE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for thebusiness associate who provided a service for the facility.
Column Comment.45: FACILITY SERVICE SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number added to allow abusiness associate to provide more than one service for a facility.
Column Comment.46: FACILITY TYPE: The type of facility that is described in this row of data, such aspipeline, tank, battery etc. This value is managed by check constraint and may onlybe equal to the name of one of the valid subtypes. Please note that FACILITY_TYPEwill eventually become a SUBTYPE and downsized to 30 characters.
Column Comment.47: FIELD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the field.
Column Comment.48: FIELD STATION ID: unique identifier for the stratigraphic field station.
Column Comment.49: FINANCE SUIMMARY IDENTIFIER: Summary information about a financialreference, such as an AFE for an activity, such as seismic acquisition or processing.Could be a cost center or any other reference number.
Column Comment.50: FOSSIL IDENTIFIER: Unique Identifier for a fossil.
Column Comment.51: FULFILLED DATE: Date on which obligation was fulfilled
Column Comment.52: FULFILLED IND: Indicated whether or not obligation has been fulfilled. This may beused in the case where all rental payments over a five year period have been madein advance, and indicates that there are no additional obligations to inc ur.
Column Comment.53: FULFILLED REMARK: narrative comments about how the obligation was fulfilled.
Column Comment.54: INCIDENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an health safety or environment relatedincident.
Column Comment.55: INCIDENT SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a set of incident types that may bemandated by an operating company, regulatory agency or contract.
Column Comment.56: INCIDENT TYPE: The type of indicent that may have occurred, such as roll-over, orexplosion, or unsafe materials handling.
Column Comment.57: INFORMATION ITEM ID: The unique identifier for an information item.
Column Comment.58: INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: the type of information item. May be one of Thevalid types of Information item as defined by check constraints.
Column Comment.59: INSTRUMENT ID: Unique number for the legal document registered on the Cert. OfTitle indicating interest in lands e.g. charge, lien, mortgage, caveat. May be naturalKey or system assigned, based on user needs and uniqueness of natural ids.
Column Comment.60: INTEREST SET IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the interest set.
Column Comment.61: INTEREST SET SEQUENCE NUMBER: unique sequencing component to allowverioning of the interest set over time.
Column Comment.62: COST ID: unique identifier for each land right cost.
Column Comment.63: LAND OFFERING BID: Unique identifier for a bid. Within the bid, individualcomponents may be sequenced using PRIORITY ORDER. This enables grouped,contingent, sliding and other types of grouped bids to be tracked.
Column Comment.64: LAND REQUEST ID: Unique identifier for the land request.
Column Comment.65: LAND RIGHT ID: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is the rights youhave to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented, aquiredby agreement or contract.
Column Comment.66: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: column indicating the type of land right. Must be one of thevalid subtypes: LAND TITLE, LAND UNIT, LAND UNIT TRACT, LANDAGREEMENT, LAND AGREE PART.
Column Comment.67: LAND SALE BID SET: the entity is used when bids placed on land offerings aregrouped according to some requirement. A company may group bids to support aspecific play or project at a company, or financially, or organizationally. This tabletracks the set or group of bids. Use LAND SALE BID SET BID to relate the set toindividual bids.
Column Comment.68: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for the jurisdiction that is managing theland sale or bidding round.
Column Comment.69: LAND SALE NUMBER: A unique identifier for the land sale.
Column Comment.70: LAND SALE OFFERING IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the parcel of land in theland sale offering.
Column Comment.71: PROVIDED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate,such as a person, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium whoprovided this service.
Column Comment.72: BA SERVICE OBS NO: A unique number added to allow a business associate toprovide multiple services to a LAND RIGHT.
Column Comment.73: LANGUAGE: The form of a means of communicating ideas or feelings by the use ofconventionalized signs, sounds, gestures, or marks having understood meanings.Usually the language used in a document, proceding, process or appllication.
Column Comment.74: LITHOLOGY LOG ID: A unique identifier for a descriptive record of lithology.
Column Comment.75: LITH LOG SOURCE: The source of data for this lithologic log.
Column Comment.76: LR TERMINATION ID: Unique identifier for a particular termination
Column Comment.77: LR TERMINATION ID: Unique identifier for a particular termination
Column Comment.78: NOTIFICATION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the notification.
Column Comment.79: OBLIGATION COMPONENT TYPE: Type of component for this row of data.
Column Comment.80: PALEO SUMMARY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the paleo summary report thatis captured.
Column Comment.81: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.82: PDEN SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designatedas the source of information for this row
Column Comment.83: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.84: PHYSICAL ITEM ID: The unique identifier for the physical item.
Column Comment.85: POOL IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying the pool.
Column Comment.86: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.87: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.88: TABLE NAME: The name of the table within the schema.
Column Comment.89: PRODUCT_TYPE: The product identified as a component for this table.
Column Comment.90: STRING IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying a production string withina well.
Column Comment.91: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.92: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the project.
Column Comment.93: RATE and FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a businessassociate such as a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Feeschedules are often used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided.
Column Comment.94: PPDM REFERENCED GUID: The GUID in the table that has an association with thislevel of a classification system. In this case, we recommend that the name of thetable also be captured in PPDM TABLE, to make querying this information easier.Usually, the PPDM TABLE and PPDM REFERENCED GUID should be used intandem. In this case, it is essential that the PPDM GUID in the source table bemanaged carefully and appropriately.
Column Comment.95: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.96: PPDM TABLE NAME: The name of a table that has an association with this level of aclassification system. This may be used in conjunction with an approrpriate foreignkey from the table that is referenced, or may be used generically in combination withthe PPDM_REFERENCED_GUID, which points to the row in the table that is relatedto the classification system level. In this case, it is essential that the PPDM GUID inthe source table be managed carefully and appropriately.
Column Comment.97: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.98: RESERVES ENTITY IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a reserves entity. A reservesentity may be comprised of a single business object (such as a well) or a group ofbusiness objects (such as all the completions producing from a pool).
Column Comment.99: RESERVE CLASS IDENTIFIER: The reserve classed for identifying the confidencelevel and producing status of the reserve volumes.
Column Comment.100: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.101: SEIS LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the seismic license.
Column Comment.102: FLOW IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this occurence of flowing from a seismicpoint.
Column Comment.103: SEISMIC POINT ID: Unique identifier for each seismic point
Column Comment.104: SEISMIC SET SERVICE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the unique identifier for thebusiness associate who provided the service. Part of the SEIS BA SERVICE Fk.
Column Comment.105: SEISMIC SERVICE SEQUENCE NUMBER: a unique number allowing the same BAto provide more than one service for a seismic set.
Column Comment.106: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.Valid types of seismic sets include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_3D, SEIS_SEGMENT andSEIS_SURVEY.
Column Comment.107: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.108: SEISMIC TRANSACTION; A transaction in which seismic data is exchanged, sold ortraded according to the terms of an agreement.
Column Comment.109: SEIS TRANSACTION TYPE: The type of seismic transaction, such as sale, licensing,farm in etc.
Column Comment.110: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: The type of support facility that is described by thisrow of data. These values are managed by check constraint, and may only be thename of a valid sub type of support facility.
Column Comment.111: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.112: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of land. Thesurface description may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes andbounds or polygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals(substances) and subsurface definition (zones/formations) to which rights aregranted. For land rights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatialdescription.
Column Comment.113: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.114: DATA STORE ID: Used to identify the kinds of items that a data store structure ispermitted to hold.
Column Comment.115: DATA STORE STRUCTURE OBS NO: Used to identify the kinds of items that a datastore structure is permitted to hold.
Column Comment.116: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.117: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.118: SUPPORT FACILITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the support facility. A supportfacility provides operational support for activities. These facilities may include roads,transmission towers, airstrips, vessels, docks and so on.Sub tyes are used tomaintain integration with the rest of the model.
Column Comment.119: SOFTWARE APPLICATION IDENTIFIER: unique software application identifer.
Column Comment.120: RECORDS MANAGEMENT THESAURUS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a set ofwords or descriptors about a particular field or set of concepts, such as a list ofsubject headings or descriptors usually with a cross-reference system for use in theorganization of a collection of documents for reference and retrieval (from MerriamWebster Online)
Column Comment.121: THESAURUS WORD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a word or key word in athesaurus.
Column Comment.122: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.123: WELL ACTIVITY SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a valid set of activity codes,such as those required by a regulatory or professional agency.
Column Comment.124: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.125: WELL ACTIVITY TYPE: The type of activity that is tracked, such as drilling, testing,coring, tubing etc. May be any kind of activity related to well operations.
Column Comment.126: WELL LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the well license
Column Comment.127: WELL LICENSE SOURCE: Unique identifier for the source of the well license data.
Column Comment.128: WELL SERVICE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thebusiness associate who provided this service for the well.
Column Comment.129: WELL SERVICE SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number added to allow thebusiness associate to provide more than one service to the well. part of the WELL BASERVICE FK
Column Comment.130: WELL SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a Well Set. A Well Set is a groupingmechanism for Well Components used to maintain and end to end link through allstages of the Well Life cycle (planning to disposal).
Column Comment.131: DELIVERY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a delivery of a work order, either in totalor as a partial delivery. Deliveries may be sent by the service company or recieivedby the service company from another party. The sending or receiving company isindicated through the FK from WORK ORDER BA.
Column Comment.132: WORK ORDER IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the work order.
Column Comment.133: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.134: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.135: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.136: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.137: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.138: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.139: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
